channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: At AUSMIN meetings in Washington, top US officials said they did not expect any kind of “quid pro quo” from Australia in return for sharing its highly prized submarine secrets.
item.title: Peter Dutton: Australia won’t be deterred by Beijing’s ‘outbursts’ over submarines

item.dc:creator: Daniella White
item.description: An 18-year-old man has been charged over an alleged road rage attack at the testing clinic in Sydney’s west.
item.title: Man charged over alleged COVID-19 clinic road rage attack

item.description: You can buy flower and vegetable seeds everywhere from supermarkets to hardware shops but that doesn’t mean all seeds are equal.
item.title: The Mornington Peninsula farming couple putting seeds in the spotlight

item.description: The world is facing high energy prices for the foreseeable future as oil and natural gas producers resist the urge to drill again, says Chevron’s chief executive.
item.title: Big Oil boss warns of high energy prices ‘for a long time’

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: China says Australia’s nuclear submarine deal with the US and the UK “gravely undermines regional peace”. The first shipment of Moderna COVID-19 vaccines are due to arrive on Australian shores tonight.
item.title: Australia news LIVE: China reacts angrily to Australia’s nuclear submarine deal; national cabinet to discuss expansion of COVID-19 home quarantine program

item.description: Wall Street swung between gains and losses and iron ore prices slumped, dragging on the US shares of mining heavyweights BHP and Rio Tinto.
item.title: US stocks fluctuate; ASX set to open lower as iron ore price tumbles

item.description: Facebook’s security teams were expanding the tactics to do more wholesale shutdowns of coordinated groups of real-user accounts causing harm.
item.title: Facebook targets ‘coordinated social harm’ in German anti-COVID lockdown movement

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: France’s former ambassador to the US said British involvement was immaterial because they were “poodles of the Americans, as usual”.
item.title: ‘Stab in the back’: Europe’s fury with Morrison and Biden over AUKUS submarine deal

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: Let go from the Wanderers academy, overlooked for the Young Socceroos, Christian Volpato is now training under Jose Mourinho and selected for Italy’s youth team.
item.title: Cut by Wanderers but selected for Italy: How Sydney kid slipped from Australia’s grasp

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: ABC News Breakfast co-host Lisa Millar didn’t mean to make a statement by quitting the platform last week. But that’s precisely what she did.
item.title: ‘I wasn’t looking to make a fuss’: Why journalists are giving up on Twitter

item.dc:creator: Annika Smethurst
item.description: There are no rules preventing MPs living outside their electorates, but it risks sending a very dangerous message to the local community.
item.title: Parachuting pollies into safe seats fuels political cynicism

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: In the expected event that he holds his place in the Demons side, Michael Hibberd says he will be representing a host of former teammates: the Essendon 34.
item.title: ‘We’ve got a special bond’: Hibberd playing for the Essendon 34 - and his brother

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: The PM was forced to shelve a virtual Coalition party room meeting on Thursday morning after tech issues derailed his attempts to spruik the new triumvirate to his parliamentary colleagues.
item.title: Awkward AUKUS times for the PM with party room tech fail

item.dc:creator: Andrew Charlton
item.description: The genius of JobKeeper was keeping workers linked to the employers. The new payments break that link - and too many workers choose to stay at home, and that suits too many bosses.
item.title: Farewell JobKeeper, hello JobKiller: how bosses and workers are encouraged to part ways

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: This is the incredible statistic that backs up Phil Gould’s prediction that Parramatta are still a while away from winning a premiership.
item.title: The 50-year itch: Why Panthers players want it more than Eels

item.dc:creator: Lucy Carroll
item.description: A dozen of the state’s top cardiologists were forced into isolation and multiple urgent heart procedures cancelled after two unvaccinated nurses worked while infectious with COVID-19 at a major Sydney hospital.
item.title: Unvaccinated nurses bring heart procedures to standstill in Sydney hospital

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: As Australia reaches 70 per cent first dose vaccination coverage, national cabinet will consider mandating jabs for all health workers, while Greg Hunt declares public-health measures a success.
item.title: ‘Tens of thousands of lives saved’, Hunt says as national cabinet to talk mandatory vaccines

item.description: From the soil to when and where to plant them – here’s your guide to having flowers the size of saucers by summer.
item.title: Everything you need to know about growing dahlias in your garden

item.dc:creator: Anne Summers
item.description: The misogyny that hounded the nation’s first female prime minister is laid bare in a documentary, but little seems to have changed.
item.title: I see no sign that ‘ugly Australia’ has learnt from its treatment of Gillard

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: Victoria’s energy minister Lily D’Ambrosio says her state will reject electricity market changes that prop up fossil-fuel power stations, and any changes aimed at keeping the lights on must prioritise zero-emissions technologies.
item.title: ‘Drawing a line’: Victoria to oppose special payments for coal plants

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: When Ryan Papenhuyzen lit up the season opener, the Roosters fullback took it personally. His response this season shows why he’s still the game’s best player.
item.title: ‘I’m rattled’: The text that shows why Tedesco is still the benchmark

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Deeper deficits, higher debts and a longer wait for a balanced budget as a result of state’s latest lockdowns.
item.title: Latest lockdowns bring fresh finance horror for Pallas

item.description: We teach people how to treat us. If you’re being called nicknames in the workplace you need to immediately cease answering to it - and make sure there’s no truth to it.
item.title: You don’t want to be called ‘teacher’s pet’? Don’t act like one

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: More than 450 organisations have agreed to acknowledge and pay compensation to people who were sexually abused while in their care as children, but the survivors of groups that have not signed up to the scheme may fall through the cracks.
item.title: Cult survivors fall through the cracks in child abuse redress scheme

item.description: Didi CEO Cheng Wei pushed the limits and thrived in legal grey areas. Until China cracked down.
item.title: Didi doldrums: The rise and fall of the world’s ride-hailing giant

item.description: The key defendant in the trial acknowledged his role for the first time in the co-ordinated killings at sites across Paris in 2015, including at the Bataclan concert hall.
item.title: Deaths of 130 people ‘nothing personal’, Paris attacks suspect tells court

item.description: Cameron Woodhead and Steven Carroll cast their eyes over a batch of newly released fiction and non-fiction books.
item.title: Rampaging Roy Slaven’s memoir and a sharp crime thriller: what to read this week

item.description: Murdoch said the outspoken British journalist was “the broadcaster every channel wants but is too afraid to hire”.
item.title: Rupert Murdoch hires Piers Morgan for new TV show to air in Australia

item.description: The previously unknown work by Vincent van Gogh is a study for one of his best-known drawings, “Worn Out”.
item.title: Dutch museum finds new Van Gogh drawing of tired old man

item.description: The Prime Minister is all revved up about the nuclear-powered submarine deal with the US and the UK.
item.title: Australia a puny partner in this unequal subs deal

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today’s interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and Superquiz, Friday, September 17

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, September 17

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Inquiry to cost $2m, thieves on crest of crime wave, and Hawke delays uranium crunch.
item.title: In the Herald: September 17, 1983

item.description: By 1986 Ted and Hazel Birch had spent twenty years squatting on the outskirts of Broken Hill to escape what they called the ‘jail’ of living in town.
item.title: From the Archives, 1986: Benefits of life on fringes of society

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 17, 2021

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 16, 2021

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: Australia and its allies announced a major new security deal on Thursday to share advanced technologies including nuclear submarine technology.
item.title: As it happened: Australia-US nuclear submarine deal to counter China, NSW records 1351 new COVID cases, Victoria records 514

item.description: Hospitals, care homes and health centres began suspending thousands of unvaccinated workers as countries around Europe weigh up how far to go to combat the pandemic.
item.title: France suspends 3000 unvaccinated health staff as Europe targets jab refusal

item.dc:creator: Mathew Dunckley
item.description: Reaching a key vaccination milestone has prompted tweaks to the restrictions in Victoria’s capital.
item.title: What are the new coronavirus rules for Victoria?

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: Melbourne have ended their reliance on poker machine revenue with the club selling its pokies venue, the Bentleigh Club, for $23.7 million.
item.title: Demons reap $24 million from Bentleigh Club sale

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Ball-magnet Tom Mitchell was a runaway winner of his third Peter Crimmins Medal on Thursday night after another eye-catching season.
item.title: Mitchell claims third Hawthorn best-and-fairest crown

item.description: Pro tips for billy swinging and seedy portents.
item.title: All clear in the name games

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: During a second day of question-time pressure, the Queensland Premier largely refused to comment on allegations of interference by the Public Service Commission.
item.title: Palaszczuk denies involvement in ‘raid’ on integrity watchdog’s office

item.dc:creator: Felicity Caldwell
item.description: Queenslanders will be allowed to buy takeaway wine with their food from restaurants under COVID measures set to be made permanent.
item.title: Litre of the law: Queensland makes some COVID measures permanent

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The architect of Australia’s first short-lived move to legalise voluntary assisted dying 26-years ago has welcomed Queensland’s vote to become the fifth state to legislate a scheme, after three days of historic debate.
item.title: ‘Sense of relief’: Campaigners welcome passage of Qld’s assisted dying bill

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: The swimmer is free to compete after the Court of Arbitration for Sport dismissed an appeal seeking to reinstate the original four-year ban for a positive test.
item.title: Shayna Jack overjoyed as doping nightmare finally comes to an end

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: The Premier says Victorians will not be asked to show their vaccination status, indicating police will not take a heavy-handed approach to enforcing the new rules.
item.title: Outdoor alcohol ban to stay as Andrews appeals to better angels
